item.title: 4 gunmen shoot former Biñan City accountant to his death
item.description: A former accountant of Biñan City in Laguna died after four gunmen on motorbikes shot him several times in broad daylight.

item.title: Fuming France in no hurry to mend Australia ties
item.description: More than two weeks after the shock scrapping of a submarine contract with Australia, France is in no hurry to mend ties with Canberra as it weighs up whether to extract a cost for its ally's "betrayal."

item.title: Pilot hospitals for vaccination of minors identified
item.description: Philippine health officials have identified six hospitals that will host the pilot vaccination of children ages 12 to 17 against COVID-19.

item.title: Boy dies in Parañaque City fire
item.description: A boy died in a fire that hit a residential area in Parañaque City.

item.title: US concerned by provocative Chinese military action near Taiwan
item.description: The United States on Sunday slammed China for "provocative" and "destabilizing" military activity, after Chinese fighter jets and bombers made their largest-ever incursion into Taiwan's air defense zone.

item.title: Organs of artist Bree Jonson returned after autopsy -PNP
item.description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) clarified that there were no missing internal organs from the body of artist Breanna “Bree” Jonson who was found dead in La Union last month.

item.title: Philippines registers 13,273 new COVID-19 cases
item.description: The Philippines reported 13,273 new COVID-19 infections on Sunday, bringing the number of active cases in the country to 112,008.

item.title: MMDA street sweeper injured in EDSA-Ortigas Flyover hit and run
item.description: A street sweeper of the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) was rushed to a hospital after he was injured in a hit and run on the EDSA-Ortigas Flyover on Sunday morning.

item.title: Mahigit 50 nahuling lumalangoy sa Manila Bay, tiniketan
item.description: Tiniketan ang mahigit 50 na tao sa Pasay City dahil nahuling lumalangoy sa Manila Bay.

item.title: Blast kills at least two civilians near Kabul mosque
item.description: An explosion outside a mosque in the Afghan capital killed at least two people on Sunday, senior Taliban officials said.

item.title: Dubai Expo revises worker fatalities to 6 after including COVID-related deaths
item.description: Expo 2020 Dubai, a major world fair that opened last week, on Sunday said three workers on the project had died after contracting COVID-19, revising up the number of fatalities since 2015 to six workers.

item.title: Fire devastates Honduras' Caribbean resort island of Guanaja
item.description: A huge fire destroyed or damaged more than 200 houses and businesses on the Honduran island of Guanaja on Saturday, forcing hundreds of residents to flee for safety and ravaging the tourism-dependent resort, relief authorities said.

item.title: Phuket opens to all vaccinated travelers
item.description: Fully vaccinated travelers from any country can now book holidays to tourism haven Phuket, the Thai government has announced, under tweaks to a struggling quarantine-free travel scheme.

item.title: New Zealand tightens travel rules as COVID-19 spreads
item.description: New Zealand announced Sunday tighter border restrictions, as new cases of COVID-19 emerged in areas previously free of the coronavirus.

item.title: Samira Gutoc files COC for senator in Eleksyon 2022
item.description: Civic leader Samira Gutoc on Sunday filed her certificate of candidacy for senator in Eleksyon 2022.
